verbs.description: mediatize (third-person singular simple present mediatizes, present participle mediatizing, simple past and past participle mediatized)

entries.meaning: To make (a state or leader under the Holy Roman Empire) into a mediate vessel rather than an immediate one directly under the emperor; (by extension) to annex while preserving certain rights and titles. [from 19th c.]
examples: In all, 112 imperial Estates were mediatized or lost to France, including virtually the entire church lands east of the Rhine […].

entries.meaning: To reduce the effect of (something) by introducing a mediating agent. [from 19th c.]
To filter (an event etc.) through the mass media; to exploit (something or someone) for media exposure. [from 20th c.]
